p: Hyaluronidases can be found both in M. alligatoris and M. crocodyli, but sialidase is absent in M. crocodyli, which may explain why it is less virulent than M. alligatoris [ 161]. The sialidase and hyaluronidase of M. alligatoris act in rapid organism invasion, dissemination, necrosis, nutrient scavenging, and induction of pulmonary fibroblast apoptosis [ 161, 163].
